comment: I've had the worst experience with professor Coto. She would never answer my emails and on the occasion that she would, she would give an attitude or answer in one or two words. Never graded work, even if it was turned in she'd mark it as missing and it was impossible to receive a grade because she won't answer emails. DON'T RECOMMEND!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She was a great teacher, very lecture heavy. Had group work during class that she would collect and grade. Participation matters in this class.

The quizzes are difficult, and the exams are impossible. I have always been an all A student. This course gave me my first B since middle school. Also, the textbook is DREADFUL. The assignments are okay, except the time where I had to read 15 articles only to answer like four questions. Lastly, nothing on D2L works. Every link is broken.

I gave her an amazing review last semester. This semester, she's a completely different person. I emailed her twice, two days apart, no response. When she responded 4 days later, she claimed I was giving her anxiety with my "long" email and that she would respond later next week. ITS A FOUR WEEK CLASS! Her tests were messed up, filled w/ symbols.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: I really don't get the low rating. I had a good time with Dr. Coto. She had all the units open at the beginning of the semester(minus the exams), & nothing was too crazy. There is a discussion for each unit, a few larger discussions & a big paper, but the class overall was pleasant and informational. I took this as an elective & I don't regret it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I cannot believe the low rating. Dr. Coto is an exemplary teacher who does not require textbooks and gives each module in easy, segmented pieces. There were essays due weekly, but this is COLLEGE, you HAVE to work to get your grade. She offers two homework passes and wonderful feedback on how to improve. She truly cares and is one of my fav prof.!
You have a quiz every week that is on lockdown + webcam and a discussion post. You have a midterm that is 5 pages and summarzing an article. Wack class and would not recommend

In taking Sociology of Family class, her syllabus is not 100% accurate. She is pretty lenient on late discussion posts, but the issues are her quizzes. The questions aren't copy and paste terminology from the textbook, which is great if you want the student to apply what was learned, but not given 1 minute per question if it is application-based.

She gives extra credit, is accessible after class, and speaks clearly. Study guides are too broad relative to the test material, which covered minute details, not things she emphasized in class or the study guide. She embarrasses students who don't respond to opinion questions "correctly." It felt as though she wasn't a seasoned professor.

Lecture heavy but the PowerPoints didn't help with tests or quizzes. Very inconsistent with study guides. One test she made super easy with excellent study guide and then another she made very broad and difficult to study for. Very heavy on in-class group work. Overall I wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: If you want an easy grade, take her. She runs through the powerpoint so fast that we couldn't take notes & she was very lecture heavy. She only reads out of the textbook. However, her tests and quizzes were very easy. Quiz mostly every week. YOU DON'T HAVE TO BUY THE TEXTBOOK. She was weird on phone use too so be aware of that. Overall, an easy A.
